actions.committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.

official_title: A bill to amend the Act entitled "An Act to provide for the termination of Federal supervision over the property of the Klamath Tribe of Indians located in the State of Oregon and the individual members thereof, and for other purposes", approved August 13, 1954 (25 U.S.C. 564w-2) to provide for Federal reimbursement to such tribe of reasonable litigation expenses incurred by such tribe.

summary.text: Directs the determination and award by the court of all reasonable expenses incurred by the Klamath Indian Tribe because of a condemnation action brought by the Secretary of Agriculture to acquire all of such tribe's forest lands which such tribe's trustee is required to sell by the terms of its trust agreement and which are to become part of the Winema National Forest, Oregon.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Act entitled "An Act to provide for the termination of Federal supervision over the property of the Klamath Tribe of Indians located in the State of Oregon and the individual members thereof, and for other purposes", approved August 13, 1954 (25 U.S.C. 564w-2) to provide for Federal reimbursement to such tribe of reasonable litigation expenses incurred by such tribe.
